title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Don't be silly.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Stay awake and steer.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: You still may have some luck.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I'd like to buy some...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ...if there is a place where they sell it.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: What would I buy it with?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: A lost harpoon, a broken knife?Two bad hands?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: You might.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: You tried to buy it with 84 days at sea.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: They almost sold it to you, too.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I must not think such nonsense.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Luck is a thing that comes in many forms...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ...and who can recognize her?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I wish I could see the lights of Havana.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I wish for too many things.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: But that is what I wish now.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He saw the reflected glareof the light of the city...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... at what must have beenaround 10:00 at night.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He was stiff and sore now.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: And his wounds and all the strainedparts of his body hurt.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He could no longer talk to the fish.It was ruined too badly.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Then something came into his head.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Half-fish.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Fish that you were...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I am sorry I went out too far.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: It ruined us both.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: But we have killed many sharks, you and I.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: And ruined many more.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: How many have you ever killed, old fish?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: You do not have that spear for nothing.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: " What will you do nowif they come in the night?" he thought.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: What will I do if they come in the night?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I'll fight them!
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I'll fight them until I die!
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "But I hope I do not have to fight again,"he thought.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: " I hope so much I do nothave to fight again!"
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: But he fought again, and this timehe knew the fight was useless.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He knew he was beaten now,finally and without remedy.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I'm sorry, fish.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He could feel he wasinside the current now.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: And he could see the lights ofthe beach colonies along the shore.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He knew where he was now,and it was nothing to get home.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "The wind is our friend," he thought.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Then he added, " Sometimes.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "And the great sea,with our friends and our enemies.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "And bed.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: " Bed is my friend. Just bed.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "Bed will be a great thing."
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: It is easy when you are beaten.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: What beat you?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Nothing. I just went out too far.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Man is not made for defeat.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Man can be destroyed, but not defeated.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: It was quiet in the harbor...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... and he sailed up onto the little patchof shingle below the rocks.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: There was no one to help him.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He unstepped the mast, furled the sail...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... and he shouldered the mastand started to climb. It was then...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... that he knew the depth of his tiredness.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He had to sit down five timesbefore he reached the shack.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: In the morning, it was blowing so hardthat the drifting boats...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... would not be going out.And the boy had slept late...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... then had come to the old man's shack...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... as he had come each morningwhile the old man was gone.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: The old man was asleep.The boy saw he was breathing.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Then he saw the old man's handsand started to cry.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He went out quietly to bring some coffee...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... and all the way down the roadhe was crying.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Many fishermen were around the skifflooking at what was beside it.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: One was in the water, measuringthe skeleton with a length of line...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... and preparing to take off the head.The boy did not go down.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He had been there before.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: A can of coffee,with plenty of milk and sugar in it.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: What a fish that was!
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: There has never been such a fish.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Although those were two fine fishyou took yesterday.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Never mind about my fish.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Does he want a drink of any kind?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: No. If he does, I'll be back.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Tell him how sorry I am.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Thanks.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I'll get the coffee.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: They beat me, Manolin.They truly beat me.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He didn't beat you. Not the fish.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Did you suffer much?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Now we'll fish together again.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I am not lucky anymore.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: To hell with luck!I'll bring the luck with me.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: What will your father say?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I don't care what he says!
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: We must get a killing lanceand keep it on board at all times.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: It must be very sharp.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: And not tempered so it will breaklike my knife broke.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I'll get another knife.How long will the heavy wind last?
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Maybe three days, maybe more.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I'll have everything in order.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: You get your hands well, old man.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: They will be all right in a couple of days.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: I know how to care for them.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: During the night,I spat up something strange.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: It felt like something in my chestwas broken.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Get that well, too.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Drink your coffee.I'll get you something to eat.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: And bring me the papersfrom the time I was away.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: That afternoon, there were touristsfrom Havana at the caf�.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: One looked down at the water...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... and among the empty beer cansand dead barracuda...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... she saw the long backbone ofthe great fish that was nowjust garbage...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: ... waiting to go out with the tide.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "What's that?" she asked the waiter.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "Shark," he said, trying to explainwhat happened to the marlin.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: " I didn't know sharks had such handsome...
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "...beautifully formed tails,"the woman said.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: "I didn't, either,"her male companion answered.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: Up the road in his shack,the old man was sleeping again.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: He was still sleeping on his faceand the boy was watching him.
title: The Old Man and the Sea

text: The old man was dreaming about the lions.
title: The Old Man and the Sea
